mdRecord.dcterms:description: Design probably by Town and Davis with James Dakin; builder Seth Geer or Greer, contractor. Originally nine houses. The original buildings located at 418–426 Lafayette Place were torn down following a failed proposal in 1902 to relocate the remaining structures to Bryant Park, after more than half were torn down to make room for Wanamaker's warehouse and department store. -- https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Colonnade_Row [work]
